features: ❀【𝐔𝐥𝐭𝐫𝐚-𝐒𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐠 𝐌𝐚𝐠𝐧𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐬𝐦】Our magnetic strip for knives is crafted from premium Acacia wood, meticulously processed for outstanding durability yet sturdy construction; Powerful magnets ensure your knives securely adhere to the magnetic knife strip, providing a safe storage solution

❀【𝐄𝐱𝐪𝐮𝐢𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐞 𝐋𝐨𝐨𝐤】This stylish wooden knife magnetic holder features a modern curved design that enhances the aesthetics of your kitchen or any room where you choose to install it; And the natural grain and sheen of Acacia wood add an elegant and organic touch to your space; Make it a perfect gift for cooking lovers or your loved ones on any occasion

❀【𝐒𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐥𝐞 𝐈𝐧𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧】2 simple but sturdy methods: no-drill installation and screw installation to meet different requirements; Screw mounting provides a stronger weight capacity and is compatible with various wall types which is ideal for those who want a stable and long-lasting solution; Alternatively, No-drill Mounting makes efficient use of wall space, featuring an enhanced adhesive for increased stability and firmness, and is hassle-free; Comes with detailed instructions

❀【𝐒𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐞-𝐒𝐚𝐯𝐢𝐧𝐠 & 𝐔𝐩𝐠𝐫𝐚𝐝𝐞 𝐊𝐢𝐭𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐧】No more bulky knife blocks or cluttered drawers. Our magnetic knife strip neatly holds your knives on the wall, freeing up more kitchen space. No more guessing which knife you want by pulling the handles one by one. All your most used knives will be fully visible and in reach. No more worrying about knives scattering or messy kitchen drawers. Keep your knives' edges and blades sharper and prevent them from getting damaged in a drawer

❀【𝐌𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐢𝐩𝐮𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐌𝐚𝐠𝐧𝐞𝐭𝐢𝐜 𝐁𝐚𝐫】The knife magnetic strip serves as a convenient kitchen utensil rack, practical home organizer and stylish art supply holder. It's an ideal magnetic holder for kitchen, utility room, laundry room, garage, and more. Use it to securely store knives, scissors, utensils, keep your tools organized, store small toys, and even keep your keys handy. Additionally, it's an excellent kitchen storage choice for those with boats or RVs

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Upgrade Your Kitchen with Style: MHXW SXPN Magnetic Knife Strip If you have any beautiful and high-quality knives, Showcase them to add the finishing touch to your kitchen. Your guests will surely be impressed.

Versatile Knife Holder: Beyond the Basics In addition to being the perfect knife holder for kitchen and tool workspaces, it's also an ideal magnetic strip for utility rooms, offices, garages, and other areas to store art and craft tools, keys, and more.
Maximize Your Space Say goodbye to bulky knife block and cluttered counters. Our magnetic knife holder for wall are the perfect solution for freeing up valuable kitchen space.
Screw Mounting & Drill-free Mounting Our magnetic knife strip comes with an instruction manual, providing detailed and simplified installation instructions for your convenience.

Protective finish that won't scratch blades Prized for its exceptional strength and durability, the magnetic knife holder is perfect to store kitchen tools in a cleaner way Elegant Handcrafted from Acacia Wood Elevate your kitchen aesthetics and functionality with our Magnetic Knife Strip crafted of sustainably sourced Acacia wood. Transform your culinary space into a stylish haven with this elegant and functional accessory. Great for RV and Rentals For tenants who can't drill holes in walls, our strong adhesive bar offers a no-drill solution for a quality knife holder. Also ideal for RV, camper, boat owners, keeping everything securely in place. NOTES 1.Pacemakers may be affected. Keep a distance of at least 6 inches from the magnet bar. 2.The bar should be installed horizontally and the knives should be placed vertically. 3.Please use adhesive strips for fridge mounting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Classy, nice-looking real-wood bar full of strong magnets
reviews.reviewText: This is a really nice looking piece of wood, relative to this type of product -- and at first glance you wouldn't necessarily know it's full of magnets, as you have to get really close and carefully examine it to figure out where the seams might be that allowed the manufactured to open this up to seal magnets in it.And the magnets are quite strong -- I'm able to place knives, steel rulers, and other metal tools anywhere along the length of the bar and they stick well (not my heavier tools, but anything of around standard kitchen knife-weight sticks well). It's not quite as strong of a magnetic grasp as another magnetic bar I own that's made of steel, but considering that the magnetic power is having to travel through the wood covering in this case it's pretty impressive.The only potential con of note is that although hanging it up is easy and works well -- you just put a couple of screws in the wall (use the anchors if you're going into drywall without a stud, of course) while leaving the heads of the screws slightly outside of the wall, and then hang this bar onto the screws using the keyhole-style indents carved into the back of the bar... Again, this works great, and it also makes it very easy to take the bar off of the wall to clean it (or to clean the wall behind it, if needed) or to move it to a different location. The only downside to this being that if the bar were to be jostled upward in just the wrong way when taking a knife off the bar -- it's possible you could end up accidentally pulling the entire bar off the wall, which could be dangerous if you've loaded it up with knives....On the other hand, the bar also comes with some good 2-sided adhesive that can be used to hang up the bar in locations where you don't want to put screws into the wall. Although adhesive can also not always last forever -- depending on the surface you're attaching too (e.g., even if the adhesive is great, the paint on the wall you're attaching it to might not be), and the grease, heat, and humidity in a kitchen could contribute to wearing the adhesive out eventually...I usually always choose screw-in methods over adhesive methods when it comes to securing things to walls, when possible, especially if it's an object that's important to not one day fall on the ground (I'd count sharp knives as things I'd never want falling, haha -- it's more dangerous than, say, putting up a hook that's going to hold your kitchen towels).So, if this is a worry, and perhaps especially if you're placing a lot of heavy knives on the bar, the most secure hanging method might be to combine the 2 provided options, and use both the adhesive strip and the screws to double-up on securing this bar to the wall -- although you might need to use a couple of longer screws for this, since the adhesive strip adds a little bit width to the back of the bar.A more secure method I've seen on some other magnet bars involves either first screwing in an entire backing plate than the bar then securely slides or clamps into; or screw holes that go through the entire bar, instead of only hanging off the back... Those create very solid connections. (And if you were really worried I suppose you could drill a couple of holes straight through this wood bar and mount it that way (hoping not toe crack the wood or hit the magnets when drilling.) However, those designs can also result in a more utilitarian looks as well -- whereas this Acacia Wood magnet bar looks so slick a discreet in part because it's not utilizing those techniques...It looks like one smooth, seamless piece of wood. Which is nice. So I guess I'd just say be careful with hanging it, and maybe don't overload it with knives, and perhaps be a little gentle taking the knives on and off it as well (outside the mounting aspects, you also don't want to scratch the wood up -- but you should also be able to polish/oil/wax out any scratches later anyway).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars From Knives to Screwdrivers
reviews.reviewText: These magnetic strips are so handy and easy to use. I don't adhere them to anything as I have stucco/plaster walls, but easy enough to mount. I have several, one in the kitchen, one in the mudroom for handy frequently used tools and one in the barn for my tools I use outside like my fencing tool and a small pry bar, along with hooks to hold bungees and my limb saw. These keep things handy and in easy reach if always put back where they belong and these strips make putting things back a quick chore. Nice to come back from fixing fence and put everything away at once. I could use more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful alternative to the thick magnetic strips.
reviews.reviewText: This is a beautiful alternative to the magnetic strips used in some kitchens. The wood is a gorgeous deep brown, shaped with nice curves, and completely smooth, with nice grain. The magnet is strong, securely holding large and small knives, and looks lovely. I am very impressed with the quality of the workmanship, and instead of hiding my knives in an undercabinet drawer, I can display them on something attractive - so that's a bonus! When my friend saw it, she loved it so much she bought one for her newly renovated kitchen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Magnetic Force Inconsistent | Weak in Areas
reviews.reviewText: This Magnetic Knife Holder for Wall, crafted from 16" Acacia Wood, presents a mixed bag of features that culminate in a 3-star rating. While the smooth finish adds aesthetic appeal to any kitchen space, my experience with the product left something to be desired. The one I received had a rough, unfinished section, about the size of a $1 coin. This imperfection detracted from the overall visual appeal and quality of the product.One of the primary features of a magnetic knife holder is its ability to securely hold knives in place. However, the magnet strength of this particular holder fell short of expectations. I found the magnetic force to be inconsistent across the length and face of the wood mounting surface. This inconsistency compromises the holder's effectiveness in securely holding knives, leading to potential safety concerns and frustration during use.Despite these drawbacks, the smooth finish of the acacia wood is undeniably pleasant to look at and adds a nice touch to the kitchen wall. Overall, while this Magnetic Knife Holder offers aesthetic appeal with its smooth finish and acacia wood construction, its flaws in magnet strength and quality control merit a 3-star rating. Improvements in magnet consistency and quality assurance processes could make this product a knockout.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pretty with just the right holding power
reviews.reviewText: This is a pretty knife bar at a great price. I love the little swoop in the middle. Also, I am always worried with my metal magnet bar that I might chip an edge on my santoku knife. With wood, I won't worry. The magnets are strong enough to hold the knives very well through the wood. Even my large meat knife stayed in place as did my small bladed boning knife and a heavy chef's knife. The package comes with standard keyhole slots on the back and with foam sticky tape to give options on how to mount the knife bar. I really like this knife bar.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars looks beautiful works great
reviews.reviewText: Magnetic Knife Holder for Wall This is a beautiful piece of wood and better still it is a very useful product. Before having this knife holder my very sharp knives (My husband likes to keep all our knives with a razor sharp edge) were precariously sitting on a shelf above the kitchen sink now they are nicely displayed and moved to a location where we do most of our chopping. Beautiful and functional- win win!
